captions.text: - This is good.
Oh my!
This place is expensive!
- Maybe we can get a pizza for the table?
- Yeah, like two or three.
- I might just, I might just sit out.

Yeah, I'm not really
that hungry, actually.
I'll just have a water.
Is there free refills here?
There is? Okay, cool, nice.
I'll just have two waters, then.
Oh, bread's here!
Yay!

- We'll just take two
medium pizzas for the table.
- Just for the four of them.

I'm not eating, I'm just
here for the company.
Could we get some more bread?

There's no way that you guys
are going to eat all of this.
Could I just try that?
That looks really interesting.
These two are stuck together.
I guess I'll just take both of them.
That was really good.
What's the pepperoni like?
Does anyone not like crust?
You know, the ketchup and the bread
is a lot similar to that pizza.

Once again, this isn't
a $25 pizza, though.

You know, we could have
just gone to Little Caesars.
I seem to have forgotten my card.
- Oh, they take cash.

- Remember when we went to
TJ's party and we had to

bring a six-pack of beer,
and I covered you for that?

So I think you actually owe
me, what is that, like $4.50?

'Cause, I mean, I technically
only ordered bread,

so I guess I'll pay
one-fifth of the bread.
- What are we going to tip him?
- Ah, I mean, was he really that good?
- Tip the guy. Just tip him.
- Like, I don't have any quarters on me.

Cool, here's your tip for
your exceptional service.
- You know what, on second thought,
I gotta pay for parking, so...

comments.text:
if someone is using me and my wallet we have a problem but if a friend is 
short on money or whatever i pay no problem. everyone needs to eat and in

feed homeless people real meals all the time and eat with them too, food is 
best enjoyed with company. btw im not rich or anything i just love to share﻿

comments.text:
I used to be friends with this one girl who borrowed $20 from my other 
friend to buy a shirt (anime shirts are expensive af apparently). When it 
was my other friend's birthday, the girl just gave her back $20 and didn't 
even get her a present. I asked where the other friend's present was and 
the girl was like "paying her back is her present." Like wtf yo. Girl 
wouldn't even pitch in $1.50 to buy the birthday girl a crepe. ﻿

comments.author: DeathlyCrunch

comments.text:
There's a difference between being broke (aka having very little money and 
not being able to afford what you like so you don't buy anything) and being 
cheap (but let it be known that there are two type of cheapskates, those 
who won't spend their money OR mooch off of the people they know and those 
who won't spend their money but will in every chance take advantage of 
others and are living parasites, the latter will drain you with no remorse)﻿
comments.author: Namea123

comments.text:
Tipping is stupid in my opinion. Tipping isnt even required or even 
accepted in Europe since servers actually get paid good enough to make it 
without tips..its sad that we have to do that here.﻿
comments.author: 2short99

comments.text:
This piss me off to no end. Mostly when friends say 'oh I'm not going to 
get anything, just water' but then just eat things from your plate. Once or 
twice sure you're not hungry. Everytime to take advantage of someone no. 
Plus cover the tip. Tips aren't crazy and it's just considerate. I could 
rant on forever. But also if there is somewhere expensive don't go. Ask 
which restaurant and look up the menu before and if you dont want to go 
there for the price speak up.﻿
